intro: Picradenia biennis, commonly known as the two-year picradenia, is a deciduous shrub native to parts of Asia, particularly China and India. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits. It is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
